alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued March 15 at 3:23AM PDT until March 15 at 12:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PDT TODAY... * WHAT...Large waves with average breaker heights of 20 to 25 feet expected. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast and Curry County Coast, especially west and west-northwest facing portions of the coast line. * WHEN...Until noon PDT today. * IMPACTS...Large breaking waves will create hazardous conditions along and within the surf zone, and could inundate beaches and low lying shorelines, at times, especially at and around the time of high tide. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Bar crossings are likely to be especially difficult this morning due to 14 to 18 foot swells with a dominant period of 18 seconds. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Stay away from the surf zone and off of jetties. Area beaches may become hazardous due to dangerous surf conditions.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
